name: Banner
headline: Banner makes software for CRE owners to manage capital spend
description:
Banner is the operating system for real estate teams. From building acquisition to disposition, Banner moves all communications, workflows, spreadsheets, and file-sharing into one system. With Banner, customers automate away 80%+ of their administrative work, saving up to 10% on project costs.
The company is founded by Mark Murphy who formerly worked in RE finance, along with Kunal Chaudhary and Eric Gao, both UC Berkeley EECS alums.
generated_description:
**Company Overview: Banner**

---

**Website:** [withbanner.com](https://withbanner.com)

**Founded:** 2020  
**Location:** New York, NY  
**Founders:** Mark Murphy, Kunal Chaudhary, Eric Gao  
**Team Size:** 35 employees  
**Funding:** Recently raised a $10M Series A from Blackstone  
**Batch:** Y Combinator Batch S19  
**Tags:** Marketplace, SaaS, PropTech, New York

---

**Mission Statement:**  
Banner builds software that empowers commercial real estate (CRE) owners to efficiently manage their capital expenditures.

**Background:**  
Banner started with a broader scope—an operating system tailored for real estate teams. The platform simplifies the complex web of communication, workflows, spreadsheets, and file-sharing, enabling users to concentrate on what truly matters. By automating over 80% of administrative tasks, Banner helps clients achieve significant savings, up to 10% on project costs.

**Key Features:**
- **Centralized System:** Consolidates all project data into one platform.
- **Automation:** Minimizes manual data entry by integrating key financial data seamlessly.
- **Real-Time Spend Control:** Provides insights and controls when they matter most, making project delivery more predictable.
- **Comprehensive Project Management:** Tools for budgeting, cost tracking, approvals, milestones, and reporting all in one place.

**User Experience:**  
Clients appreciate the tool's configurability; they can retain their existing processes while transitioning from outdated systems to Banner. The focus on customer-centric customization sets Banner apart in a crowded field.

**Testimonials:**  
Clients from diverse backgrounds, including multi-family developers and co-working spaces, have praised Banner for its ability to address their most pressing pain points. Noteworthy endorsements highlight how Banner's adaptability and ease of use facilitate smoother operation management.[1][2][3]

**Recent Developments:**  
In October 2023, Banner secured a $10 million Series A funding round led by Blackstone, an affirmation of its potential in transforming the CRE landscape.

Banner’s trajectory is poised for growth as it continues to hone its offerings for the CRE sector. If you're looking to streamline communication and management of capital spend, Banner may just be the tool you need.

--- 

**For more information and to book a demo, visit their website:** [withbanner.com](https://withbanner.com)

---
